intro: Zabelia biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered zabelia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the spring and summer seasons. Zabelia biflora is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
